channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+4030] The Gates of Hell Just Opened In Guatemala
item.description: "This can't be real"; was my first thought. Then I checked the source: The Guatemalan government. What you are looking at here is a sinkhole that just appeared in the Zone 2 of Ciudad de Guatemala. And it's very real.

item.title: [+3837] Space: It's....Vast [PIC]
item.description: Warning: This may make you feel very very small.

item.title: [+2744] Google Bans Microsoft Windows Company-Wide
item.description: Google has banned Microsoft Windows from internal use. Employees will be given the choice between Apple's Mac OS and Linux. Adding insult to injury, Google is also publicly citing Windows security problems for the decision and blaming Windows vulnerabilities for the China hacking incident.

item.title: [+1863] Study: Lots of Money Doesn't Motivate Smart People [Vid]
item.description: If you run a company, or just work for one - You might want to check this out.

item.title: [+1383] Power of Trees (pics)
item.description: Nothing can stop these trees to grow. Amazing strength of nature!

item.title: [+1298] Baptists punish 15-year-old for being raped
item.description: She was raped by an older church member, then forced to apologize in front of the congregation for becoming pregnant.

item.title: [+840] 25 Years of "You've Got Fail": 18 of AOL's Biggest Mistakes
item.description: This week AOL celebrates the company’s 25 year anniversary. Throughout the internet service provider turned online advertising company’s history, they’ve been the force behind some of the most epic web-related fails known to man.

item.title: [+688] IE6 Drops Below 5% Usage, Pummeled by Chrome
item.description: Internet Explorer 6 has finally dropped to less than 5 percent share in the US, new data from StatCounter shows.

item.title: [+660] Android's Froyo vs. iPhone OS4.0. Who Wins?
item.description: The Mobile OS Battle Heats Up.

item.title: [+635] Star Wars IPad Briefing
item.description: What do you get when you combine the audio from Steve Jobs iPad introduction and the Death Star attack briefing from Star Wars: A New Hope?

item.title: [+632] Debt Collectors Forced to Pay $1.5m After Racist Voicemails
item.description: A Texas debt collection company had a unique style for reminder voicemails to one black customer: "This is your motherf-cking wake-up call you little lazy ass b-tch. Get your motherf-cking n-gger ass up and go pick some motherf-cking cotton fields."

item.title: [+604] Obama Not the 1st President to Miss Memorial Day @ Arlington
item.description: Let's set the record straight. Mr. Obama will participate today in a ceremony at Abraham Lincoln National Cemetery. He is not the first president to be away from Washington on a patriotic holiday. The critics were either ignorant of the facts or they failed to mention when Vice President Dick Cheney spoke while President Bush was in Texas.

item.title: [+599] The poor spend 9% of income on lottery tickets; here's why
item.description: So why do people without a lot of money play the lottery, especially if they know that the odds are against them? I have some theories, ranging from the obvious to, hopefully, the insightful.

item.title: [+582] Physicists solve missing neutrino mystery
item.description: For decades physicists had observed that fewer neutrinos - electrically neutral particles that travel close to the speed of light - arrived at Earth from the Sun than solar models predicted.

item.title: [+564] Fighting for 'made in the USA'
item.description: Nearly all of the world's battery manufacturing industry is in Asia, where plants can be built faster and supplies and equipment are much easier to get than in the United States. Why that is, is a story of the obstacles to a rebirth of U.S. manufacturing, and of the tantalizing possibilities if such a rebirth could be achieved.

item.title: [+555] Former Vice President Al Gore to separate from wife Tipper
item.description: BREAKING NEWS: Former Vice President Al Gore and his wife, Tipper, are separating after 40 years of marriage.
